availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Maria O. Steel Burns in Bath County on February 5, 1845. Father of Mary E. Burns, Alvin Burns, Hubbard Burns, Margaret Burns, Julia Burns, Cloyd Burns, Gilbert Burns, Fastus Burns, and Lucy Burns. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 4B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 17.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273004, p. 840 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
